name: Lain
content: Qubit! Wake up already. You can't just sleep all day—we need to get the next batch of seeds into the soil.

name: Qubit
content: Ughhh… just five more minutes. The farm will still be here, you know.

name: Lain
content: Five more minutes won't grow wheat! Now get moving. Use the arrow keys ↑, ↓, ←, and → to walk around the farmland. Try walking in all four directions!

requirement.description: Walk in all four directions using arrow keys

name: Qubit
content: Alright, walking around... Got it. This is actually easier than I thought!

name: Lain
content: Good! Now let's get you set up with the coding terminal. Click on the 'Code Editor' button to open the programming interface.

name: Lain
content: Perfect! This is where the magic happens. You can write code to automate your farming tasks. The terminal has different sections: your main code window, function definitions, and execution controls.

name: Lain
content: Let's start with something simple. In the main code window, type exactly this: plant("wheat") - this is how you plant wheat seeds when standing on farmland.

requirement.description: Type plant("wheat") in the code editor

name: Qubit
content: Okay, typed it in. But how do I actually make it do something?

name: Lain
content: Great question! See that play button (▶) in the interface? Click it to execute your code and watch Qubit perform the action!

requirement.description: Click the play button to execute code

name: Lain
content: Excellent! Now you understand the basics. But typing individual commands is still tedious. Let's learn about movement commands. Clear your code and try typing one of these: move_left(), move_right(), move_up(), or move_down()

requirement.description: Type any movement command in the code editor

name: Qubit
content: Oh wow, I can control myself with code! This is actually pretty cool.

name: Lain
content: Now you're getting it! Click the play button again to execute your movement command and see Qubit move automatically!

requirement.description: Click the play button to execute movement command

name: Lain
content: Perfect! You've mastered the basics: manual movement with arrow keys, opening the code terminal, writing simple commands, and executing them. Now you can combine these to automate your entire farming operation!

name: Qubit
content: This is amazing! I can already imagine writing scripts to plant entire fields while I take a nap. Thanks for teaching me, Lain!
